conclusion: Finding the pressure exerted by the sled on the ground using free body diagram analysis.
Given values: Mass of child = 30 kg, Mass of sled = 10 kg, Applied force = 100 N at 37° above horizontal, Constant speed (acceleration = 0), sin(37°) = 0.6, cos(37°) = 0.8, g = 10 m/s².
Horizontal component of force F_x = 80 N, Vertical component of force F_y = 60 N.
In vertical equilibrium: N + 60 N = 400 N, thus N = 340 N.
In horizontal equilibrium: Friction force = 80 N.
The normal force exerted by the sled on the ground is 340 N.
Pressure = Force / Area, but area is not given.
The magnitude of the force exerted by the sled on the ground is 340 N.
